oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Johnson Brothers Radio Show - WAVU - Tape 3
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is of the Johnson Brothers Radio Show for the WAVU radio station of Albertville, Alabama. Tape is labeled part three of an unidentified number of tapes.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Johnson Brothers String Band
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Rass Johnson (unconfirmed) introduces "Patty on the Turnpike" -- (00:23) Patty on the Turnpike (Johnson Brothers String Band) -- (02:08) Rass show his appreciation for the audience and introduces Jesse Johnson (unconfirmed) -- (2:46) Jesse performs a radio spot for Sand Mountain Truck and Tractor Company -- (03:57) Rass reflects on the amount of people who write into the show and introduces "Sweet Bunch of Daisies" -- (04:43) Sweet Bunch of Daisies (Johnson Brothers String Band) -- (08:08) Rass addresses Uncle Jim Smith -- (08:41) Old Joe Clark (Johnson Brothers String Band) -- (10:41) Rass introduces "Black Mountain Rag" -- (11:09) Black Mountain Rag (Johnson Brothers String Band) -- (13:10) Jesse performs a radio spot for Sand Mountain Truck and Tractor Company -- (15:00) Rass introduces "I'll Fly Away" -- (15:30) I'll Fly Away (Johnson Brothers String Band) -- (16:57) (Unidentified fiddle tune) [featuring Jesse Johnson outro comments] (Johnson Brothers String Band) -- (18:09) (Unidentified fiddle tune for Hunter's Grocery Store) (Johnson Brothers String Band) -- (18:30) Rass introduces "Bonaparte's Retreat" -- (19:22) Bonaparte's Retreat (Johnson Brothers String Band) -- (21:22) Rass invites Jesse to perform a commercial spot for Hunter's Grocery Store -- (22:16) Rass introduces "John's Got a Wooden Leg" -- (22:41) John's Got a Wooden Leg (Johnson Brothers String Band) -- (24:33) Rass introduces "Hide Me, Rock of Ages" -- (25:21) Hide Me, Rock of Ages (Johnson Brothers String Band) -- (27:41) Rass invites Jesse to perform a commercial spot for Hunter's Grocery Store -- (29:29) Under the Double Eagle (Johnson Brothers String Band) -- (32:08) Rass introduces "Snowbird in the Ashbank" -- (32:22) Snowbird in the Ashbank [incomplete] (Johnson Brothers String Band)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Johnson Brothers String Band (Musical group);
